dialogue.speaker: None
text: Click to Start

dialogue.speaker: None
text: As usual, your morning starts with a visit from your neighbour.

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Morning, Fox!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Beaver! Good to see you. What's the plan for today?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Hey, Beaver.

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Marten's had the idea to take a dip in the river. Want to join?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Yeah, I might for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You walk down to the river with Beaver.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten is already in the water. Wolf is standing by the shore.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Heyo! Come have a dip with us, yeah?

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: It's a bit cold...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: That's quitter talk, Wolf!

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Well, I'm coming in. Fox?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I, uh, might take a walk first.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: That's all you ever want to do. C'mon, take a swim! You'll like it!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I'll swim when I get back, promise.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Alright, but I'm holding you to that. Hurry back.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You wander a long way into the woods.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You step into a clearing you do not recognize.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: All of a sudden, an animal falls to the ground in front of you.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Another animal flies down from above and begins to eat the first.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The new animal looks up and sees you. He bristles.

dialogue.speaker: Hawk
text: Piss off, scav! This is my kill!

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Not knowing what to say, you run back to the others.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten and Beaver are still in the river. Wolf seems to have left.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: You okay, Fox? Walk too fast?

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: You do look pretty ill, Fox. What happened?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I saw something. Out there, in a clearing.

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: What did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: There was... there was an animal. He fell right out of the sky in front of me.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: As animals are known to do, of course.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: And... there was another animal. Flew down from the sky and...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: He started... eating... the other one.

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: What?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: You're nutty, Fox. This is some bit.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: No, I... I really saw it!

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Fox, are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Come on now, Fox is just having a laugh! What part of that story sounds true!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I don't.. I don't know. But I saw it. That flying one was... crazy. He was just...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Go eat something, Fox. You always get a little loopy when you're hungry.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I'm not... I...

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Er... maybe you should take a nap, Fox.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You head back to the Hollow, confused by what you saw.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I... don't know. I think... well... I'm not sure.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Hallucations, I suspect! I bet you forgot to eat breakfast again, didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: You're always a bit loopy when you're hungry.

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Maybe you should take a nap, Fox.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I think I will.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Nothing, I just... feel a little ill.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten sighs dramatically.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: I suppose you're not well enough to swim then?

dialogue.speaker: Beaver
text: Maybe you should take a nap, Fox.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I think I will.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: On your way back to the Hollow, you run into Wolf.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: He is very flustered.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: Fox, uh, you were there, right? You saw it too?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: Out past the river. You, uh, saw the murder?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Yeah. I did.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: I... can't believe it. Right? Why did he... and.. well... Wow! You know?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I don't know. It seems crazy. It is crazy. I thought I dreamed it.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: I... we can't tell anyone, right? That would be too weird.  I...
Promise not to tell anyone?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Sure, I guess.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: I.. I think it's for the best. We don't want to panic anyone...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Ok. But if we see that flying guy again, we've got to warn the mayor.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: Yeah, sure, sure... we'll tell him later...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: We have to tell everyone! That animal is dangerous!

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: But they... they won't understand! They'll panic! Please... we can't tell. Don't tell!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Well, we should at least tell the mayor!

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: Okay, okay... fine, I'll... I'll go tell him.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Wolf wanders off, shaken.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
text: Oh! I, uh, I thought... well... never mind.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: See you later, Wolf.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You walk back to your den and go to bed.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Your sleep that night is unpleasant.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: In the morning, you wake and leave your den.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You see Marten. He looks pale.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Marten? What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: I... He... He's dead...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: It-- it ate him...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Drop it, Marten! I'm not in the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: I'm serious!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: So am I! Stop it!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: W-what are you saying, Marten? Who's dead?

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten points off into the distance. You see Beaver laying on the ground.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: He's dead.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The other animals begin to gather.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Make way, make way!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: What happened here?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: It ate him! That thing ate him!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: What are you talking about? Move back, Marten!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Oh... oh, no...

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The mayor stares at Beaver. No one moves or speaks.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: There are deep lacerations across the body.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You see what you think are teeth marks. The body has been pried open and gutted.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You aren't sure what to do now.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Mayor, I...

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Not now, Fox.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: But, I think...

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Not now.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Didn't Wolf tell you about the flying animal?

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: What flying animal? I haven't seen Wolf since yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I just thought... never mind.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I think I know what happened...

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I said not now, Fox!

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: You go quiet and turn away.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You look over at Beaver and feel sick.

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Wh-wh-- what happened?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: There was an animal in the woods. It killed him, I know it!

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Why? Why would anyone kill Beaver?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: To eat him!

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Marten, are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: What are you blathering on about, Marten! Quiet down!

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: It looks like he was... ripped open...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Why would... who...

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: This is horrible!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: May I have your attention, please!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: All we know right now is that Beaver is dead.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: We don't know who, or what, did this terrible deed.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: But we will take every effort to find the truth.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Please return to your homes. The Mayor and I will conduct an investigation.

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Please... find out who did this.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You walk for hours.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: This doesn't help your restlessness, but it makes you tired.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: It is getting late. You return to the Hollow.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: As you walk to your den, you see a light in the meeting cave.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You approach the cave.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Inside, you see the mayor and Dormouse.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: I saw Fox coming out of the forest, shaking like a leaf.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: A little later, Wolf came out looking the same.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: I went to see what they saw, and, well...

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: This is terrible... it took nothing! It's already falling apart!

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: It's in the instincts. And they must feel it, right?

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: They can't survive on our food. They feel weak.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: We should have prepared for this! Why didn't we think?

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: We failed, Rabbit. But what do we do now? We need a permanent fix. We can't--

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Be quiet, Dor! Let me think!

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Look, this is bad. We thought we could do this but we failed. Give it up!

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: What do we say about Beaver? What about Wolf? What about--

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I took care of Wolf. I convinced him to leave. He's acres away by now.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: We'll say it was... I don't know. We'll say it was that hawk.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: We'll tell them to stay indoors for a few days until the threat passes.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Well, even if that works, what about Fox?

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Calm down. I will get this situation under control.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: We need to end this, Rabbit. There's no other option!

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Let me try, Dor. I can do this.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: But they're dying, Rabbit. It's only a matter of time.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: I'm leaving tomorrow night. With or without you.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You leave before Dormouse catches you.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You return to your den for more uneasy sleep.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You wake up and leave your den. The wind is quiet.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon appears from her den as well. She comes to greet you.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Hello, Fox.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Hello, Raccoon.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: What did you see, Fox? Out in the woods?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: There was an animal. He... killed someone. I saw it happen.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Oh...

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Do you... do you think he killed Beaver too?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I... yes. It makes sense, right? He... killed Beaver. Like he killed the other animal.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Yes... I think so too. It must be.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: We'd... better go back inside, I think.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon stares off into the woods for a second, then leaves.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You need to talk to the mayor.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I don't... think so.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: I think it was someone else.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: But...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Well... I can't say more until I know for sure.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon stares off into the woods for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: I think... we should go back inside now.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon goes back into her den.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You need to talk to the mayor.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Marten says you saw an animal in the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: He said it... ate another animal.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: I heard... someone said you saw something.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I don't know what you're talking about, Raccoon.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon stares off into the woods for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Raccoon
text: We... we should go back inside, I think.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Raccoon goes back into her den.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You need to talk to the mayor.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You find the mayor in the meeting cave. He sits in the corner with his back to you.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Hello, mayor.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The mayor does not respond.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Why did Wolf kill Beaver?

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I think you know the answer to that, Fox...

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: A better question would be - "Why do animals have to eat each other?"

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Or - "Why did I keep that a secret from you?"

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Or "Why did I think it would work?"

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The mayor begins to pace.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Some animals eat each other.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: This is normal.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: It's part of you, it's how your body works, it's what you need to do to survive.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: You're dying, Fox. You should know that.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: You are weak. You can feel it. But I suppose we accept illness we think is normal.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I was tired, I suppose. Of being in fear. Or not being in control.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I was tired of what I needed to do to survive.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I didn't realize that I was trying to create a utopia.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I think I was just scared, and I wanted a solution.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: That's why I stole you. I stole you and I isolated you. As I did with the others.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Maybe it was just a test to see if it would work.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Maybe I thought it would work the first time.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I guess it's presumptuous to assume that I had any idea what I was doing. Or why.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The mayor stops pacing.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I don't know, I don't know. But it's not working.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: A speech was enough for Wolf, but that was when I thought I had this under control.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Whatever this is, it's over. And I can't clean it up.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: I'm leaving later tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mayor
text: Do whatever suits you.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The mayor sits down.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You eat the mayor.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: When you are finished, you leave the cave.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You leave the cave.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: As you leave, Dormouse approaches the cave.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Fox, I...

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: You.... oh, oh no....

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Dormouse starts tugging at his own ears.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: You killed him!

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Fox! I, uh... how are you?

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Shouldn't you be inside?

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You eat Dormouse.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I... need to leave.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Dormouse breathes deeply, then lets go of his ears.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: Yes, you do.

dialogue.speaker: Dormouse
text: You need to go as far away as you can.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Yes, I... I'll go back inside, now.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You walk past Dormouse.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: As you enter the Hollow, Marten comes out of his den.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Fox! Where are you going?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: We shouldn't be out here...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: We... Fox?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Why is there blood on your face? Are you...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: No, I... Fox, please. Don't...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: No. No, no, no....

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: What if the murderer comes back?

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten looks around fervently.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: I hate this...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Everything was so... well...

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: Why aren't we safe here anymore?

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: No...

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You eat Marten.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Marten, I didn't kill Beaver.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: But I... I did kill.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: This is who I am, I think.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I-- I don't know. I'm...

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I have to leave, Marten, before I do it again.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Something's happening, Marten.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I have to leave before it gets worse.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I just-- I have to go. I'm leaving the Hollow.

dialogue.speaker: Marten
text: B-but--

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Let me go, Marten.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Marten looks confused and hurt.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: After a moment, he steps aside.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You walk past Marten.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You continue on. You see Chipmunk ahead, blocking your path.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: When you get close, she shuts her eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Oh dear.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: I didn't want to be right.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: But that's not your blood, is it?

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Her breathing become purposefully slow as she opens her eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: I don't know what to say.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: But--

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: I want you to do the right thing.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Please.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Fox, I need to ask you a question.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: I need you to be honest.

dialogue.speaker: Chipmunk
text: Did you kill Beaver?

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You eat Chipmunk.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: I'm sorry, Chipmunk.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Chipmunk closes her eyes and doesn't speak.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: No.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: But... Who's to say I wouldn't have?

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: You know something's wrong, Chipmunk.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: But please don't worry. I'm leaving.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Chipmunk looks at you blankly.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: She nods, slightly.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You leave her standing there.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The night around you gets darker as you reach the edge of the Hollow.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You see Squirrel's tree to the right. He emerges from it.

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Fox!

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Shouldn't you be inside? It's dangerous out there!

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Come in here! You'll be safer.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You eat Squirrel.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: It's okay, Squirrel.

dialogue.speaker: Fox
text: Don't worry.

dialogue.speaker: Squirrel
text: Well... okay, Fox. But please be safe...

dialogue.speaker: None
text: He goes back inside.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You leave your old home.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You find a new one, alone.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: There you live a new life that feels familiar.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You hunt to eat.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Sometimes, you think about your friends.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Every meal makes you stronger.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The weakness falls off like dirt.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: One day in Spring, you find yourself in a part of the woods you remember.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You find bones you remember.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You don't remember most of the bones you've made over the last few seasons.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You don't remember most of the days you used to spend by the river here.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You do remember how, on some days, the wind got quiet just like this.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: There is nothing to see.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: There are no animals, no voices, no movement.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You wonder where they went. If some went together.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: If they found homes or empty spaces.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: You remember feeling concern for them, for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: Then it falls off like dirt.

dialogue.speaker: None
text: The end.
